revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-20 02:48:49.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/db/sqlalchemy/model_base.py'], 'message': 'Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave
as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I4c1b630d14030c9e451e58342b0d44e2058fa51f
'}]
commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you
define __eq__ for it to work properly [1].There are no implied
relationships among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y
does not imply that x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(),
one should also define __ne__() so that the operators will behave
as expected.
[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I4c1b630d14030c9e451e58342b0d44e2058fa51f

commit_message:
Fixed task in_bound context when retrying

Task's in_bound context was updated incorrectly.
When task with retrying policy is retrying second time
it cannot get previously published variables.

commit_message:
Enable changing of rpc driver from devstack

It enables user to set flag
'MISTRAL_USE_KOMBU_DRIVER' in local.conf on their
devstack. With this flag set to 'TRUE', mistral
would autamiatically be installed with kombu driver
enabled.

This change is needed for adding new devstack gate
that would test kombu driver

Change-Id: I462aa17107a9a55396a87a8c46fa3a8dac338fac

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-25 05:40:50.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/propose_translation_update.sh'], 'message': 'Remove translations for releasenotes from branches

Releasenotes publishing happens on master - and only from there. This is
the case for both original content and translations. Repos that get
branched might contain releasenotes translations, so remove them to not
have outdated files there.

Change-Id: I25fe1b2ac89cf34611f55048cb5d1317dd384aa1
'}]
commit_message:
Remove translations for releasenotes from branches

Releasenotes publishing happens on master - and only from there. This is
the case for both original content and translations. Repos that get
branched might contain releasenotes translations, so remove them to not
have outdated files there.

Change-Id: I25fe1b2ac89cf34611f55048cb5d1317dd384aa1

subject: Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-26 08:05:48.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/tests/unit/common/test_httpclient.py', 'tricircle/tests/unit/common/test_az_ag.py'], 'message': 'Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred
over assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(..,None)

Change-Id: I367cc785503dc4c9baa7f532610222f95d52eb50
'}]
commit_message:
Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more
specific assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred
over assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(..,None)

Change-Id: I367cc785503dc4c9baa7f532610222f95d52eb50

commit_message:
docs: Clarify sections & note on filter scheduler

Right on now the Filter Scheduler page it is difficult to find where the
section is on configuring and writing your own. The page is very long.
So this adds some section headers. In addition a note is added to
clarify that when you write your own filter "all_filters" doesn't
include "write your own", both available and default settings need to be
changed.

Change-Id: I99878d3b4dc839ff87bc581e61c85e4ae2c66b2c

commit_message:
Raise NotImplementedError instead of NotImplemented

NotImplementedError is the name of the exception
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/exceptions.html).
NotImplemented is the name of a constant
(https://docs.python.org/2/library/constants.html).
This patch fix it.

Change-Id: If0c220b8fc8480e5904400e9086935944bce728a
Closes-Bug: #1339855

commit_message:
Fix dhcp app options

Unlike other apps, options of dhcp app are registered in the [DEFAULT] group.
This patch moves all the options from default group to dhcp app group.

Partially-Implements: blueprint oslo-config-generator
Related-Bug: #1523510
Change-Id: I9294a45fcbe8884152fe0a182bc9637aafc3ec88

commit_message:
Add "disable local disks" option to flavors

This feature adds the possibility to define a flavor,
that does not create any ephemeral disks locally on the hypervisor.
If the new flavor key 'local_disks' is set to 'False', users are
"forced" to create a bootable volume to launch an instance from
that flavor.

Change-Id: I428b26a88bb6df500ad4a3daab158875e59050be
Previously-Approved: Newton
Implements: blueprint flavor-root-disk-none

commit_message:
Change assertListEqual to assertEqual

AssertEqual has been added assertListEqual，assertDictequal,
assertSetEqual and assertTupleEqual methods,in order to
unified specification,we can use assertEqual instead of
these methods.

Change-Id: If32334d1aa5e01bc3d0c5fdf65db456e8b758dd9

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-21 20:32:18.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/base/swift/storage.pp', 'manifests/profile/base/swift/ringbuilder.pp'], 'message': 'Fix Swift manifest for Puppet4 deployment

1) swift/ringbuilder: seed must be a String
Because we use validate_re in puppet-swift and puppet4 requires the
regex to be a string, not an integer.

2) Fix Swift package name
In puppet4, we need the resource title, not the resource name.

Change-Id: I50cea96d45e0eb46c19040d9a7105ab72c2dbef7
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Swift manifest for Puppet4 deployment

1) swift/ringbuilder: seed must be a String
Because we use validate_re in puppet-swift and puppet4 requires the
regex to be a string, not an integer.

2) Fix Swift package name
In puppet4, we need the resource title, not the resource name.

Change-Id: I50cea96d45e0eb46c19040d9a7105ab72c2dbef7

revisions:
[{'number': 30, 'created': '2016-09-05 10:24:04.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_firewall.py', 'neutron/common/utils.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': "ovsfw: fix troublesome port_rule_masking

In several cases port masking algorithm borrowed
from networking_ovs_dpdk didn't behave correctly.
This caused non-restricted ports to be open due to
wrong tp_src field value in resulting ovs rules.

This was fixed by alternative port masking
implementation.

Functional and unit tests to cover the bug added as well.

Co-Authored-By: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: IWAMOTO Toshihiro <iwamoto@valinux.co.jp>

Change-Id: Idfc0e9c52e0dd08852c91c17e12edb034606a361
"}]
commit_message:
ovsfw: fix troublesome port_rule_masking

In several cases port masking algorithm borrowed
from networking_ovs_dpdk didn't behave correctly.
This caused non-restricted ports to be open due to
wrong tp_src field value in resulting ovs rules.

This was fixed by alternative port masking
implementation.

Functional and unit tests to cover the bug added as well.

Co-Authored-By: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: IWAMOTO Toshihiro <iwamoto@valinux.co.jp>

Closes-Bug: #1611991
Change-Id: Idfc0e9c52e0dd08852c91c17e12edb034606a361

commit_message:
Stop plan creation when container exists

The action result was not properly checked, leading to errors being
missed and the plan creation failing, sometimes silently.

Change-Id: I8c5391be5ff7bc4c7227ebbe4f8200eda6f8de09
Closes-Bug: #1621493

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-07-26 08:50:53.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/initiator/linuxfc.py', 'os_brick/tests/initiator/test_connector.py', 'os_brick/tests/initiator/test_linuxeckd.py', 'os_brick/initiator/connector.py', 'os_brick/tests/initiator/test_linuxfc.py', 'os_brick/initiator/linuxeckd.py'], 'message': 'Support FICON-attached ECKD volumes on System z

FICON (Fibre Connection) is a Fibre-Channel FC-4 layer protocol. It is
used on mainframes to attach ECKD volumes via Fibre-Channel. While FICON
shares a common transport protocol with FCP, there are several
differences. ECKD volumes are addressed by a Control Unit and Unit
Address, rather than a LUN. Besides, different commands are required in
order to attach an ECKD volume to a hypervisor.

Implements: blueprint linux-ficon-support

Change-Id: I84726b577dc108ff748fb331812197651b4fbbac
'}]
commit_message:
Support FICON-attached ECKD volumes on System z

FICON (Fibre Connection) is a Fibre-Channel FC-4 layer protocol. It is
used on mainframes to attach ECKD volumes via Fibre-Channel. While FICON
shares a common transport protocol with FCP, there are several
differences. ECKD volumes are addressed by a Control Unit and Unit
Address, rather than a LUN. Besides, different commands are required in
order to attach an ECKD volume to a hypervisor.

Implements: blueprint linux-ficon-support

Change-Id: I84726b577dc108ff748fb331812197651b4fbbac

subject: Remove ovsdb_nb_impl.py
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-26 03:14:38.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/db/drivers/ovsdb_nb_impl.py'], 'message': 'Remove ovsdb_nb_impl.py

As a sub-class of api_nb.NbApi, ovsdb_nb_impl.OvsdbNbApi is not used
anywhere. And the logic in ovsdb_nb_impl is out of date somehow. For
example, OVN_Southbound listens to 6642, and OVN_Northbound listens to
6641 by default, however, ovsdb_nb_impl still uses port 6640 to connect
both OVN_Southbound and OVN_Northbound DB.

Besides, ovsdb_nb_impl will require installing ovn, which might cause
confusion to user, as ovn is another distributed sdn controller, compared
to dragonflow.

Besides, using ovn db to store nb db might cause conflicts, as ovn db
change will cause ovn-controller to download OpenFlow, if there is any
ovn-controller.

This patch just remove ovsdb_nb_impl.

Change-Id: I7ddc583146989bcd598b06c49c8190a1c28597f3
Related-Bug: #1622879
'}]
commit_message:
Remove ovsdb_nb_impl.py

As a sub-class of api_nb.NbApi, ovsdb_nb_impl.OvsdbNbApi is not used
anywhere. And the logic in ovsdb_nb_impl is out of date somehow. For
example, OVN_Southbound listens to 6642, and OVN_Northbound listens to
6641 by default, however, ovsdb_nb_impl still uses port 6640 to connect
both OVN_Southbound and OVN_Northbound DB.

Besides, ovsdb_nb_impl will require installing ovn, which might cause
confusion to user, as ovn is another distributed sdn controller, compared
to dragonflow.

Besides, using ovn db to store nb db might cause conflicts, as ovn db
change will cause ovn-controller to download OpenFlow, if there is any
ovn-controller.

This patch just remove ovsdb_nb_impl.

Change-Id: I7ddc583146989bcd598b06c49c8190a1c28597f3
Related-Bug: #1622879

subject: Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-26 04:39:54.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/tests/fullstack/test_pub_sub.py', 'dragonflow/tests/fullstack/test_portsec_flows.py'], 'message': 'Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific assertions.
As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(..,None)

Change-Id: I2ab46cc724665ed5362cee865c8c0dfa0e93a0ae
'}]
commit_message:
Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific assertions.
As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(..,None)

Change-Id: I2ab46cc724665ed5362cee865c8c0dfa0e93a0ae

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-26 06:39:02.000000000', 'files': ['murano/tests/unit/dsl/foundation/test_package_loader.py'], 'message': 'Use fnmatch from oslo.utils

Standard library fnmatch in Python versions <= 2.7.9 has thread safe
issue[1], we can use thread safe version from oslo.utils.

[1]https://bugs.python.org/issue23191

Change-Id: I6a205e64841ce6e4112fa14d8097d63810a46918
'}]
commit_message:
Use fnmatch from oslo.utils

Standard library fnmatch in Python versions <= 2.7.9 has thread safe
issue[1], we can use thread safe version from oslo.utils.

[1]https://bugs.python.org/issue23191

Change-Id: I6a205e64841ce6e4112fa14d8097d63810a46918

commit_message:
Fix compute node resource providers can_host value

When creating compute node resource providers, their can_host values
should be 1. This patch fixes this issue to create correct resource
providers in scheduler client.

subject: HyperV: remove instance snapshot lock
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-23 16:23:06.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/tests/unit/test_snapshotops.py', 'hyperv/nova/snapshotops.py'], 'message': 'HyperV: remove instance snapshot lock

At the moment, the instance snapshot operation is synchronized using
the instance uuid. This was added some time ago, as the instance
destroy operation was failing when an instance snapshot was in
proggress.

This is now causing a deadlock, as a similar lock was recently
introduced in the manager for the shelve operation by this change:
Id36b3b9516d72d28519c18c38d98b646b47d288d

We can safely remove the lock from the HyperV driver as we now stop
pending jobs when destroying instances.

Closes-Bug: #1611321

Change-Id: I1c2ca0d24c195ebaba442bbb7091dcecc0a7e781
(cherry picked from commit e4208017feb92de8bfbe1c3b28d6b6e3cea7ab2c)
'}]
commit_message:
HyperV: remove instance snapshot lock

At the moment, the instance snapshot operation is synchronized using
the instance uuid. This was added some time ago, as the instance
destroy operation was failing when an instance snapshot was in
proggress.

This is now causing a deadlock, as a similar lock was recently
introduced in the manager for the shelve operation by this change:
Id36b3b9516d72d28519c18c38d98b646b47d288d

We can safely remove the lock from the HyperV driver as we now stop
pending jobs when destroying instances.

Closes-Bug: #1611321

Change-Id: I1c2ca0d24c195ebaba442bbb7091dcecc0a7e781
(cherry picked from commit e4208017feb92de8bfbe1c3b28d6b6e3cea7ab2c)

There is a race condition where setting a hook, where we store the event
before and only then set the hook. If somehow if a test is fast enough
to retrieve the events and signal before the hook is actually set, it

Closes-Bug: #1626075
'}]
commit_message:
Set hooks before storing events

There is a race condition where setting a hook, where we store the event
before and only then set the hook. If somehow if a test is fast enough
to retrieve the events and signal before the hook is actually set, it
will fail. It makes more sense to set the hook first.

Change-Id: I8f3c33da37419d2d9ead27aaf43949e876236bc5
Closes-Bug: #1626075

subject: Non-clustered VM live migration fix
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-23 16:19:49.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/tests/utils/compute/test_livemigrationutils.py', 'os_win/utils/compute/livemigrationutils.py'], 'message': "Non-clustered VM live migration fix

When live migrating instances, we always request a
'VirtualSystemAndStorage' migration type.

In general, this works with shared storage as well, in which case
the instance disks should no be moved. Still, it's causing issues
when the instance disk files are placed on storage spaces disks.

This can be avoided by requesting the instance disks not to be
migrated.

This change addresses this issue, adding the 'migrate_disks' switch
argument to the 'live_migrate_vm' method.

Change-Id: I48dc6da29534bf0c477c742311ac15438d8b63ad
Closes-Bug: #1618446
(cherry picked from commit fcdbf99153ab48eeee2f641777b3fb10c06db02f)
"}]
commit_message:
Non-clustered VM live migration fix

When live migrating instances, we always request a
'VirtualSystemAndStorage' migration type.

In general, this works with shared storage as well, in which case
the instance disks should no be moved. Still, it's causing issues
when the instance disk files are placed on storage spaces disks.

This can be avoided by requesting the instance disks not to be
migrated.

This change addresses this issue, adding the 'migrate_disks' switch
argument to the 'live_migrate_vm' method.

Change-Id: I48dc6da29534bf0c477c742311ac15438d8b63ad
Closes-Bug: #1618446
(cherry picked from commit fcdbf99153ab48eeee2f641777b3fb10c06db02f)

commit_message:
vmutils: honor host argument

utilsfactory.get_vmutils accepts a host argument, yet it does not
pass it to the actual VMUtils constructor. Thus, all the operations
will be performed against the local node.

This change ensures the host argument is honored.

Closes-Bug: #1621444

Change-Id: Ia7623a689854f937d70323cf38818d7534f3ccd9
(cherry picked from commit cec7491e1c7e766a74b51b8ef9d5b7d58b115848)

commit_message:
Cluster: Fix deleting unexisting instance

At the moment, the cluster driver will raise an exception if we
try to delete an unexisting instance (which may have failed to
spawn).

This change adds a check, letting the instance destroy pass.

Change-Id: If11eab4314c250e1f899ef223f38d91c1b45dd95
Closes-Bug: #1597264
(cherry picked from commit a6540475b49457a66c84e2149df04bef7cb60395)

subject: FibreChannel: Fix missing device
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-23 16:36:01.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/tests/unit/test_volumeops.py', 'hyperv/nova/volumeops.py'], 'message': "FibreChannel: Fix missing device

At the moment, if the device path was found, we are not performing
any rescan.

This can cause issues if we retrieve the device path before it was
claimed by the MPIO service (in which case, the device number can
change). If the device number changes, the instances won't be
able to access it anymore. Also, detaching the disk will fail.

Simply performing a rescan before attempting to fetch the volume
mappings fixes this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1597002
Change-Id: Ic72afda7839c6949f3e833061d1143ae9e49fe16
(cherry picked from commit cf25f5c62a678672b93537ce4adac7fd5dcfb677)
"}]
commit_message:
FibreChannel: Fix missing device

At the moment, if the device path was found, we are not performing
any rescan.

This can cause issues if we retrieve the device path before it was
claimed by the MPIO service (in which case, the device number can
change). If the device number changes, the instances won't be
able to access it anymore. Also, detaching the disk will fail.

Simply performing a rescan before attempting to fetch the volume
mappings fixes this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1597002
Change-Id: Ic72afda7839c6949f3e833061d1143ae9e49fe16
(cherry picked from commit cf25f5c62a678672b93537ce4adac7fd5dcfb677)

In that ISO we have PostgreSQL configured for tracing detailed
info about deadlock.

subject: cluster-config return absolute path
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-21 18:11:41.000000000', 'files': ['magnumclient/v1/clusters_shell.py'], 'message': 'cluster-config return absolute path

Currently cluster-config returns relative path. In case current
working directory is changed then relative path will not work.
Changes has been made to return absolute path. Which solve the
problem introduced by relative path.

Note: The issue was already fixed in bay-config [1] and this commit
ported it to cluster-config.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/358403/

Change-Id: Ic27a28e55e2115355febb9d7e405bda5500eda22
Closes-bug: #1614682
'}]
commit_message:
cluster-config return absolute path

Currently cluster-config returns relative path. In case current
working directory is changed then relative path will not work.
Changes has been made to return absolute path. Which solve the
problem introduced by relative path.

Note: The issue was already fixed in bay-config [1] and this commit
ported it to cluster-config.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/358403/

Change-Id: Ic27a28e55e2115355febb9d7e405bda5500eda22
Closes-bug: #1614682

subject: Correct the directory of "nova-compute.conf"
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-09-23 01:24:53.000000000', 'files': ['doc/quickstart.rst'], 'message': 'Correct the directory of "nova-compute.conf"

Kolla will look for a file in
``/etc/kolla/config/<< service name >>/<< config file >>``,
so nova-compute.conf should be in /etc/kolla/config/nova directory

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I27c0af90079f41abe744ab93dc85a12c56124d86
'}]
commit_message:
Correct the directory of "nova-compute.conf"

Kolla will look for a file in
``/etc/kolla/config/<< service name >>/<< config file >>``,
so nova-compute.conf should be in /etc/kolla/config/nova directory

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I27c0af90079f41abe744ab93dc85a12c56124d86

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6854, 'name': 'YAMAMOTO Takashi', 'email': 'yamamoto@midokura.com', 'username': 'yamamoto'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 7715, 'name': 'Hirofumi Ichihara', 'email': 'ichihara.hirofumi@gmail.com', 'username': 'Hirofumi-Ichihara'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14257, 'name': 'Mahito Ogura', 'email': 'm.ogura@ntt.com', 'username': 'Mahito'}, {'_account_id': 14764, 'name': 'Yuki Nishiwaki', 'email': 'uckey.1067@gmail.com', 'username': 'ukinau'}, {'_account_id': 22752, 'name': 'Hanxi Liu', 'email': 'apolloliuhx@gmail.com', 'username': 'Hanxi_Liu'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-04-07 04:16:25.000000000', 'files': ['lib/rpc_backend'], 'message': "Assurance status of rabbitmq is running

I changed it so that rabbitmq always restart.

Current devstack don't restart rabbitmq in case of ubuntu. Because
rabbitmq is running at default.
But this approach have the following bug.
If rabbitmq is already installed and not running ,  stack.sh will
fail.
So I change it so that rabbitmq always restart.

Closes-bug: #1030798
Change-Id: Ie45446d3817b2f15631f03b2af84749fe936c67b
"}]
commit_message:
Assurance status of rabbitmq is running

I changed it so that rabbitmq always restart.

Current devstack don't restart rabbitmq in case of ubuntu. Because
rabbitmq is running at default.
But this approach have the following bug.
If rabbitmq is already installed and not running ,  stack.sh will
fail.
So I change it so that rabbitmq always restart.

Closes-bug: #1030798
Change-Id: Ie45446d3817b2f15631f03b2af84749fe936c67b

commit_message:
Fix integration test

This patch fixes integration test for nova server cluster
creating/deleting by removing "key_name" property from
profile spec since there is no "oskey" keypair created
automatically during gate environment setting up.

Change-Id: I4cb3d7326824533eb7855f65b5fc6319a1202db4

to 'generated_at' in openstacksdk.
